DOCNAME: CVEKLOVA AND OTHERS v. THE CZECH REPUBLIC
TEXT: The applicants are :
PERSON , born in DATE and living in GPE ( no . GPE ) ;
Mr PERSON and PERSON , born DATE and DATE respectively , and living in GPE ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) ;
PERSON , born in DATE and residing in GPE , GPE , represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE ( no . CARDINAL ) ;
PERSON , born in DATE and living in GPE ( no . CARDINAL ) ;

ORG , who was born in DATE and lived in GPE . She was represented by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE ( no . CARDINAL ) . By a letter received at ORG on DATE the applicant ’s lawyer informed the ORG that on DATE the applicant had died and that her CARDINAL children wished to pursue the application in her stead ; and
PERSON , born in DATE and living in GPE ( no . CARDINAL ) .
They are NORP nationals . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Mr PERSON , from ORG .
The facts of the cases , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

In DATE an easement was established over the applicant ’s property in favour of her neighbour . As the latter had reconstructed his house so that it encroached on the applicant ’s land , on DATE , the applicant requested ORG ( okresní soud ) to order him to allow the officers of ORG entry onto his plot of land for a survey .
On DATE she lodged a new action seeking this time to clear the property .
On DATE ORG stayed the proceedings initiated by the applicant in DATE .
It appears that the applicant ’s action for the clearance of the property is currently pending before the national courts .

On DATE the applicants brought an action in ORG ( městský soud ) for recovery of property which they had been forced to sell in DATE . It appears that the proceedings are still pending before the national courts .

In DATE the applicant left the former GPE . On an unspecified date he acquired NORP citizenship . On CARDINAL DATE ORG ( okresní soud ) convicted the applicant in absentia of deserting the Republic , sentenced him to DATE years’ imprisonment and ordered the confiscation of all his property , including a plot of land in GPE .
On DATE the same court declared that , pursuant to LAW , the applicant ’s convictions and all ancillary decisions had been quashed with retrospective effect .
On DATE the applicant re - acquired NORP citizenship .

On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) abrogated the condition of permanent residence within the territory of GPE , laid down in LAW , for persons claiming restitution . On DATE the ORG adopted Act No . CARDINAL , which amended LAW , setting a new deadline for the lodging of restitution claims by the persons concerned , i.e. those who had not , until DATE , satisfied the permanent residence condition .

On DATE the applicant lodged an action for restitution of the land which ORG granted on DATE . In a judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG ( krajský soud ) modified ORG judgment in that it dismissed the applicant ’s restitution action finding that on DATE , he had not satisfied the restitution requirements laid down by LAW . Actually , he was not a NORP citizen and did not reside permanently on the territory of GPE . The court held that the amendment of Act No . CARDINAL/CARDINAL did not concern the applicant ’s case .
On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) dismissed the applicant ’s appeal on points of law .

On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s constitutional appeal ( ústavní stížnost ) stating , inter alia , that on DATE ( expiry of the time - limit for introducing restitution claims under LAW ) , the applicant had not been a NORP citizen and that the new time - limit set up in Act No . CARDINAL/CARDINAL was not relevant in his case .
On DATE the applicant brought an action in the PERSON nad GPE ORG ( okresní soud ) , claiming damages for an injury he had sustained when working in uranium mines .
On DATE ORG stayed the proceedings following the applicant ’s withdrawal of his action filed on DATE . This decision became final on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was dismissed from her work following a breach of the rules of work discipline . On DATE she filed an action against her employer seeking to declare her dismissal null and void .
It appears that the proceedings are still pending before the NORP courts .

On DATE the applicant lodged an action for unjust enrichment against a private building company with the Prague CARDINAL ORG ( obvodní soud ) . It appears that the proceedings are still pending before the national courts .

The relevant domestic law and practice concerning remedies for the excessive length of judicial proceedings are stated in the ORG ’s decision in the case of PERSON v. GPE , no . MONEY ( dec . ) , § § CARDINAL - CARDINAL , DATE ) .
